intro: Microlicia pulchra, commonly known as the beautiful microlicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
